message: I’m at my wit’s end with your company. I’ve been waiting over a month for my business insurance certificate, and it’s affecting my operations.

Good afternoon, my name is Sarah. I’m truly sorry to hear about the delay with your certificate. I completely understand how important this is, and I’ll do everything I can to resolve this for you today.
I’ve heard this before. This isn’t the first time I’ve contacted you, and nothing’s changed.

I completely understand your frustration. To help resolve this, I’ll need to verify your details so I can access your account. Could you please confirm your business name, policy number, and the registered contact email address?
Fine. The business name is Elite Landscaping, the policy number is 456789, and the email is elite.landscaping@example.com.
Thank you for confirming. Let me review your account. Please bear with me for a moment while I check the details.

I can see that your certificate was delayed due to an internal processing error. I’ve escalated this to our compliance team, and your certificate will be issued within 24 hours. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused.
This should have been done weeks ago. I want to make a formal complaint about how this has been handled.

I’m very sorry to hear that, and I completely understand your frustration. I’ll file your complaint immediately and ensure it’s reviewed by our complaints team. You’ll receive a confirmation and further details within two business days. Is there anything else I can assist you with in the meantime?
No, I just want to see some action this time. I’ve had enough of excuses.

I completely understand, and I assure you this matter is being prioritized. Thank you for bringing this to our attention, and I apologize again for the inconvenience. Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you need any updates.
